reviews.review_title: Great place for a one night stay with family
reviews.positive_text: The property is very well located with close proximity to the train station and many of the attractions are within walking distance. The staff were really nice and accommodating.

The hotel boasts a brilliant location, conveniently close to the train station, making it easy to find. There are numerous coffee shops, bars, and restaurants in the vicinity, providing ample options for dining and entertainment.
reviews.negative_text: Due to high occupancy, the housekeeping staff seemed overworked. It was common to see housekeeping trolleys parked outside rooms, which made the hallways quite messy.

reviews.positive_text: It said there was parking that would be nice to know were it was because it was not known till you checked in and finding a place in the street was a nightmare

reviews.review_title: Ideal for a short stay in Annecy
reviews.positive_text: The property is about 5 minutes walk from the main railway station, which was great as we were travelling by train. Our room on floor 2 was air-conditioned as described. The en-suite was spacious with high quality (Hansgrohe) shower fittings. There is an elevator to the upper floors. We had no need for breakfast, so did not use the breakfast room, but I noted that it had a high-quality coffee machine that was there all day. There was also chilled water in reception plus lemon/lime water as well. There was also a terrace at the back of the hotel so breakfast could be eaten outside also. As we wanted to leave mid to late afternoon, we were able to leave our cases with reception which was very useful. The hotel also accommodated our early arrival around 1:30pm too.  Our room had traditional wooden shutters that could be closed - great for keeping the heat out in summer. Staff on the desk were very friendly and spoke English willingly (not that I required it).
reviews.negative_text: I would have liked to be able to adjust the fan speed for the air-con so that the room could be cooled down quicker. Apart from that minor point, we had no issues.

reviews.review_title: Had the room not had a funky smell, things would have been alright.
reviews.positive_text: The room was quiet and the bed comfortable.

The room size was OK, but they could have used more insulation between the rooms, especially the bathrooms . Breakfast rooms were very small for the number of rooms. Room was good. Excellent shower.
The street view from the room was very good - I enjoyed having that. Despite being on a busy street, it was quiet at night. The hotel was really convenient to visit the old town of Annecy and fairly easy access to the lakeside area too.
reviews.negative_text:
Bathroom was small  but very adequate, with a great shower. However, with a not insignificant step up into the bathroom from the room. Quite a hazard really because if you tripped and fell into the bathroom, the washbasin protrudes. 
A polite but basic welcome from the staff. No attempt to to offer breakfast nor any additional the hotel, nor about the immediate about the area around the hotel. 
Parking was inconvenient. I parked at the railway station over the two nights - which in itself was fine. Quite a way to walk if you have a lot of heavy luggage though. Again, not much information or recommendation regarding parking closer, nor any information about public transport available.
The hotel entrance is not very visible from the street - I passed it twice! Once inside, the reception desk is located at the top of a short flight of steps. I think there was a stair lift for less able guests to get to the reception desk level. The standard lift was then accessible from that level.

The hotel seemed overwhelmed with the amount of guests during our stay (or didn't prepare for that amount of guests), the breakfast was a chaos, we were told that the kitchen is out of stock ~1hr before official breakfast closure time, most of the tables were full of dirty dishes. To be fair, whatever was available, was tasty, but that wasn't much.

reviews.positive_text:
It's the wonderful option if you want something simple for a good price and you want to be in the city center. 
1. Location is perfect, it's just 3 minutes from the railway and bus station and you're in the city center already. The area is safe and full of stores, restaurants and supermarkets. 
2. Staff was very friendly, helped us with the luggage, we truly appreciate it.
3. The room was very spacious. The design is simple but fine for us, so we enjoyed our stay there.
Special thanks for the free hot chocolate near the reception, it was awesome to drink something hot when we were waiting for our bus.
We'll be back one day for sure!

All the stuff just the nicest people on earth, smily, sweet and welcoming, they happy help with everything you need. It felt better then any luxury hotel can fell for the really normal and reasonable price. I was in love with that place. The room was warm, the bed was very good, mattresses and pillows. The shower is big and the mirror light in the shower very well. The location just perfect!! Very good and beautiful neighborhood, the train station just around the corner, all the old city is there because the train station just 3 min walk from the old city. Or it is the old city. It‚Äôs 10 min of a beautiful walk to the lake, so wherever you wanna go it‚Äôs just right there. I was very pleased and would definitely come again.

The location was amazing for us, which is right next to the train station and just a few blocks away from the main areas of Annecy. On arrival we returned our car to the train station, and we left on a bus from the very same spot the day after, so it was just super convenient. Right next to the hotel there were interesting design shops and explorable pathways, so it was nice to walk around. The room was clean and large enough for our group.

reviews.negative_text:
Le cose che non mi sono piaciute sono diverse:
1) manca il bidet, sembra una cosa di poco conto, ma dato che in questi alberghi non vanno solo i francesi dovrebbero soddisfare anche le esigenze di chi non e'bozzone.
2) manca un frigorifero nella stanza.
3) Ero nella stanza 309, che si affacciava su una strada molto trafficata, e quindi la mattina presto c'era questa sveglia... non voluta.
4) Difronte all'ingresso dell'hotel, c'e' un bar, per cui fino alle 2/3 di notte il chiasso assordante dei giovani non faceva dormire. 
5) Sono stato 5 giorni, ma un giorno la mia stanza non e' stata pulita. Ho protestato alla reception e mi hanno candidamente detto che l'addetta alle pulizie aveva dimenticato... INCREDIBILE, ma se' l'unica cosa che fa come fa a dimenticare? E' come se un chirurgo dimenticasse di operare! Inaccettabile.
6) La televisione aveva pochissimi canali francesi. Italiani neanche uno. Ma se sei un hotel in una zona turistica ti devi aspettare che possano venire anche ospiti NON francesi. Assurdo.
7) Sono arrivato alle 13.30 e non ho potuto prendere la stanza perch√© si pu√≤ solo dopo le 15. Come??? pago la stanza per un giorno, e quel giorno praticamente non posso utilizzare la stanza, mezza giornata buttata al vento.  Ma cose da pazzi. E sapete perch√©'? essendo molto le stanze, e essendo solo 2 persone addette alla pulizia, e' chiaro che ci impiegano tanto tempo. Se i proprietari dell'hotel non avessero il braccino corto, le stanze potevano essere pronte molto prima delle 15. Vergona.
